channel.title: Nim-lang on Code One
channel.description: Recent content in Nim-lang on Code One

item.title: [Nim4LeetCode] 2. Add Two Numbers
item.description: Problem You are given two non-empty linked lists representing two non-negative integers. The digits are stored in reverse order and each of their nodes contain a single digit. Add the two numbers and return it as a linked list. You may assume the two numbers do not contain any leading zero, except the number 0 itself. Example Input: (2 -> 4 -> 3) + (5 -> 6 -> 4) Output: 7 -> 0 -> 8 Explanation: 342 + 465 = 807.

item.title: [Nim4LeetCode] 1. Two Sum
item.description: Problem Given an array of integers, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to a specific target. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice. Example: Given nums = [2, 7, 11, 15], target = 9, Because nums[0] + nums[1] = 2 + 7 = 9, return [0, 1]. Solution import tables proc twoSum(nums: seq[int], target: int): (int, int) = var idxMap = initTable[int, int]() for i in 0.
